children.name: main
children.definition: /meɪn/  more important than anything else:chính, quan trọng nhất.
examples: ▪ Ben’s main problem was lack of money.
▪ You should clearly state your main idea at the beginning of the essay.
▪ We walked up the stairs to the main entrance of the building.
▪ The main reason kids don’t get vaccinated is that parents don’t realize how important it is.

children.name: principal
children.definition: chiefB2/ more important than anything else.Chiefandprincipalmean the same as main, but they are used especially in written or formal English:chinhs, chủ yếu.
examples: ▪ Coffee is the country’s principal export.
▪ Kendall’s chief complaint about the opera is that the characters are not historically accurate.
▪ The chief purpose of the march was to draw attention to the poor condition of schools.

children.name: major
children.definition: /ˈmeɪdʒəʳ/  one of the most important or serious things - use this especially when there is a small number of really important things, but a larger number of less important things:quan trọng, chủ yếu.
examples: ▪ Smoking is a major cause of heart disease.
▪ I thought we agreed to talk to each other before making any major decisions.

children.name: major city :large and important city
examples: ▪ Gang activity that was limited to major cities has now spilled over to towns and rural areas.

children.name: key
children.definition: /kiː/  a key person or thing is one that is the most important because everything depends on them:then chốt, chủ chốt
examples: ▪ We don’t have much time, so let’s concentrate on the key issues.
Chúng ta không còn nhiều thời gian, vì thế cần tập trung vào những vấn đề then chốt.
▪ Transport and communications are key areas of the economy.
Giao thông vận tải là lĩnh vực then chốt của kinh tế.
be key to (doing) something: là chìa khóa để làm một điều gì đó.
▪ Laws are key to maintaining an orderly society.
Luật lệ là chìa khóa để duy trì trật tự xã hội.

children.name: primary
children.definition: /ˈpraɪməriǁ-meri/  the most important one:quan trọng nhất, hàng đầu.

children.name: primary concern/responsibility/reason/role etc
examples: ▪ As always, security is our primary concern.
▪ Financial reward is the primary reason most people work.

children.name: prime
children.definition: the one most likely to be chosen:hàng đầu, căn bản.

children.name: prime suspect/target/candidate
examples: ▪ Tourists are prime targets for theft and robbery.
▪ The FBI regarded him as its prime suspect in the case.

children.name: ▪ Cheryl is a prime candidate for the new managerial position
predominant
children.definition: /prɪˈdɒmɪnənt, prɪˈdɒmənəntǁ-ˈdɑː-/  more noticeable, more powerful, or more common than others:nổi bật, chủ đạo
examples: ▪ Yellow is the predominant color in most of his paintings.
▪ When we visited the country, our predominant impression was one of poverty and hardship.

children.name: core
children.definition: use this about the main and most important parts of a subject, activity, plan etc:cốt lõi, nồng cốt.
examples: ▪ We concentrate most on teaching the core skills of reading, writing, and mathematics.

children.name: ▪ The government will discuss what they say are the core issues of education and health care
the main part of a problem, idea, or belief
crux
children.definition: the most important part of a difficult problem, a question, or an argument etc that must be dealt with or understood before any further progress can be made:mấu chốt
examples: ▪ Whether we can get funding or not is the crux.

children.name: the crux of the matter/problem/question etc
examples: ▪ Finding a cheap source of energy is really the crux of the matter.

children.name: ▪ The crux of the court case is whether consumers deserve a refund
essence
children.definition: /ˈesəns/  the main feature or quality that gives something its own special character:bản chất

children.name: the essence of sth
examples: ▪ Equality is the essence of democracy.
▪ The essence of his teachings can be summed up in the phrase ‘Know yourself.

children.name: heart
children.definition: /hɑːʳt/  the most important part of a problem, consideration, question etc:điểm cốt lõi, điểm trọng tâm

children.name: the heart of the matter/problem/question etc
examples: ▪ Let’s stop talking about irrelevant issues, and get to the heart of the matter.

children.name: lie at the heart of something
examples: ▪ Money always lies at the heart of our fights.

children.name: go/get to the heart of something
examples: ▪ This new book gets to the heart of the controversy over nuclear power.

children.name: core
children.definition: /kɔːʳ/  the main part of an idea, belief, way of thinking etc, that everything else depends on:điểm cốt lõi

children.name: the core of something: cốt lõi của cái gì đó
examples: ▪ The core of the play’s appeal is that the good guys win in the end.
Điểm cốt lõi của về hấp dẫn của trò chơi là người chiến thắng là người cuối cùng.

children.name: to the core of something: cốt lõi của cái gì đó
examples: ▪ She had the ability to cut through to the core of a problem.
Cô ấy có khả năng cắt ngang cốt lõi của một vấn đề.

children.name: at the core of something: ở điểm cốt lõi của vấn đề
examples: ▪ The profit motive is at the core of the capitalist system.

children.name: Động cơ lợi nhuận là điểm cốt lõi của Tư bản chủ nghĩa
the bottom line
children.definition: /ðə ˌbɒtəm ˈlaɪnǁ-ˌbɑː-/  the main fact about a situation, that must be accepted and cannot be changed or avoided:điểm cốt yếu
examples: ▪ Most people want to work in a place where they feel valued. That’s the bottom line.
Hầu hết mọi người đều muốn làm việc ở nơi họ cảm thấy có giá trị, đó là điểm cốt yếu
the bottom line is: điểm mấu chốt là
▪ The bottom line is, he’s gone and he’s not coming back.
Điểm mấu chốt là, anh ta ra đi và anh ta không trở lại.

children.name: the main ideas in a piece of writing, speech, etc
the main points
children.definition: the main/key points/ðə ˌmeɪn, ˌkiː ˈpɔɪnts/  the main ideas or the basic meaning of a speech, piece of writing etc:ý chính, ý quan trọng
examples: ▪ I made a few notes of the main points I wanted to cover in the speech.
▪ The following article explains four key points that all new investors should understand.

children.name: the gist
children.definition: the general meaning of a speech, argument, piece of writing etc, without all the details:quan điểm, ý chính.

children.name: the gist of
examples: ▪ The gist of the article is that children should have more rights in deciding their own futures.

children.name: get the gistunderstand the general meaning
examples: ▪ I couldn’t hear everything they said but I got the gist.

children.name: the thrust
children.definition: of sth the main aim or purpose of an argument, speech, or political action:mục đích của
examples: ▪ The whole thrust of the US policy was to isolate Cuba.
▪ The thrust of the case is whether the federal law overrides the state ban.

children.name: essentials
children.definition: /ɪˈsenʃəlz/  the most important facts or ideas in a statement, for example in a description of events or a set of arguments or opinions:mức thiết yếu
examples: ▪ When reduced to their essentials, most religions are not so different.

children.name: essentials of
examples: ▪ She was always very quick to grasp the essentials of an opponent’s argument.

children.name: the most important
children.definition: ▪ This was possibly  scientific discovery of the 20th century.
examples: ▪ For Muslims, this is the most important day of the year.
▪ If there is a fire, the most important thing is to get all the students out of the building immediately.

children.name: priority
children.definition: /praɪˈɒrɪti, praɪˈɒrətiǁ-ˈɔːr-/  the most important thing, which needs to be dealt with before anything else or given more attention than anything else: quyền , sự ưu tiên
examples: ▪ First, let’s decide what our priorities are.
▪ My main priority is get through all my exams.

children.name: first/top/number one priority
examples: ▪ Safety has always been our number one priority.

children.name: give priority to sthdecide that something is very important, and deal with it urgently
examples: ▪ The President promised to give priority to reducing unemployment.

children.name: urgent
children.definition: /ˈɜːʳdʒənt/  something that is urgent must be dealt with or done as soon as possible, especially because something very bad could happen if it is not:
examples: cấp bách , khẩn cấp [tính từ ] 1 thứ gì đó khẩn cấm phải được giải quyết hay hoàn thành sớm nhất có thể , đặc biệt là thứ gì đó rất tệ cơ thể xảy ra nếu nó không được giải quyết , hoàn thành
▪ I’ve got one or two urgent letters to write.
Tôi có 1 hoặc 2 bức thư khẩn cấp cần phải viết
▪ Your sister’s been calling -- I think it’s urgent.
Chị/em giái bạn đang gọi điện - Tôi nghĩ nó rất khẩn cấp
▪ An international effort is required to cope with the urgent needs of the earthquake victims.
1 sự nổ lực quốc tế là điều cần thiết để đối phó với những nhu cầu cấp bách của các nạn nhân động đất
urgently[adverb]
gấp rút , khẩn cấp , cấp bách [trạng từ ]
▪ Mr Van Heeren is leaving on a trip and needs those papers urgently.
Ông Van Heeren đang trên chuyến đi và cần những giấy tờ khẩn cấp
urgency[uncountable noun]
sự khẩn cấp , cấp bách
▪ This is a matter of great urgency.
Đây là 1 vấn đề hết sức khẩn cấp

children.name: be at the top of the agenda
children.definition: to be the most important and urgent of all the things that have to be done, especially by a government or company: đứng đầu chương trình nghị sự
examples: ▪ Getting inflation down is at the top of the agenda.
▪ The government were reluctant to put equal pay for women anywhere near the top of the agenda.

children.name: take precedence over
children.definition: /ˌteɪk ˈpresdəns əʊvəʳ/  if someone or something takes precedence over someone or something else, they are more important and need to be dealt with first:

children.name: overriding
children.definition: /ˌəʊvəˈraɪdɪŋ◂/  overriding need/concern/consideration etc the thing that is most important and must be dealt with before anything else:
examples: quan trong hơn, trọng yếu, trọng điểm [tính từ chỉ đứng trước danh từ ] nhu cầu / sự quan tâm/sự xem xét trọng yếu vv là thứ quan trọng nhất và cần giải quyết trước bất cứ thứ gì khác
▪ The overriding need here is to end the civil war.
Nhu cầu trọng yếu ở đây là kết thúc cuộc nội chiến
▪ an overriding concern to secure business efficiency
Một mối quan tâm trọng yếu để bảo đảm hiệu quả kinh doanh

children.name: paramount
children.definition: /ˈpærəmaʊnt/  more important than anything else: tối cao , tối thượng
examples: ▪ The patients’ wishes and needs are paramount and they must always come before our own.
▪ While some musical ability is necessary, it is not the paramount concern.

children.name: of paramount importance
examples: ▪ Public safety and security are matters of paramount importance.

children.name: big
children.definition: /bɪg/ :

children.name: to lớn
examples: ▪ The city has a big problem with drugs.
Thành phố có một vấn đề lớn về ma túy.
▪ If you think I’m coming with you, you’re making a big mistake.
Nếu bạn nghĩ rằng tôi đang đến với bạn thì bạn đã gây ra một sai lầm lớn.

children.name: major
children.definition: /ˈmeɪdʒəʳ/  having aseriousandimportanteffect, especially ona lot of people, places, situations etc:

children.name: lớn, trọng đại ( ảnh hưởng lên rất nhiều người, nơi... )
examples: ▪ Heavy traffic is a major problem in most cities.

children.name: Nhiều xe cộ lưu thông là vấn đề chính ở hầu hết các thành phố
examples: ▪ Think carefully before you decide on such a major undertaking.
Nghĩ cẩn thận trước khi bạn quyết định về một cam kết lớn .
▪ Nuclear weapons are a major obstacle on the road to peace.
Vũ khí hạt nhân là trở ngại chính trên con đường hòa bình.

children.name: considerable
children.definition: /kənˈsɪdərəbəl/ formalhaving a fairly large or important effect:

children.name: đáng kể
examples: ▪ The recent slowdown in the US economy is likely to have a considerable impact on the rest of the world.
Sự suy thoái gần đây trong nền kinh tế Mỹ có thể sẽ có tác động đáng kể đến phần còn lại của thế giới.
▪ There was a considerable delay in the processing of our application.
đã có sự chậm trễ đáng kể trong việc xử lí đơn của bạn.

children.name: great
children.definition: /greɪt/  use this toemphasizehow much of an effect something has, especially agoodeffect:

children.name: to lớn ( nói về ảnh hưởng tốt )
examples: ▪ Thanks. You’ve been a great help.
Cảm ơn. Bạn đã giúp đỡ rất nhiều.
▪ It would be of great assistance if customers could have the exact money ready.
Sẽ rất tốt nếu khách hàng có sẵn số tiền để đưa.
▪ I have great difficulty in reading without my glasses.
Tôi gặp khó khăn khi đọc sách mà không đeo kính.

children.name: huge/enormous/immense
children.definition: /hjuːdʒ, ɪˈnɔːʳməs, ɪˈmens/  use this toemphasizethat something is extremely big, important, or serious:

children.name: rất lớn, to lớn, nghiêm trọng
examples: ▪ The city of Detroit has a huge crime problem.

children.name: Thành phố Detroit có một vấn đề tội phạm nghiêm trọng
examples: ▪ Enormous changes are taking place in the way we communicate with each other.

children.name: đã có nhiều sự thay đổi to lớn trong cách giao tiếp của chúng ta
examples: ▪ The difference between living in the country and living in the city is immense.

children.name: Sự khác biệt giữa việc sống ở quê và ở thành phố là rất lớn
examples: ▪ His contribution to the team’s success has been immense.

children.name: Sự cống hiến của anh ta cho thành công của đội bóng là rất lớn
tremendous
children.definition: /trɪˈmendəs/  use this toemphasizehow big,important, and oftenexcitingan effect will be:

children.name: cực lớn ( gây hứng thú )
examples: ▪ My new job will be a tremendous challenge.

children.name: Công việc mới của tôi sẽ là một thử thách lớn
examples: ▪ Your advice has been a tremendous help to us.

children.name: Lời khuyên của cậu sẽ là một hỗ trợ quan trọng đối với tôi
examples: ▪ It was a tremendous thrill, meeting her in person.

children.name: Thật sự rất kinh ngạc khi gặp cô ấy ngoài đời
large scale/large-scale
children.definition: /ˌlɑːʳdʒ ˈskeɪl◂/  involving a lot of money or effort, or a lot of people or places:
examples: rộng lớn , quy mô lớn
▪ Large-scale development has given new life to the inner city.
Sự phát triển với quy mô lớn đã đem lại cuộc sống mới cho nội thành.
▪ We need large-scale investment in the industry’s future.
Chúng ta cần sự đầu tư quy mô lớn cho tương lai của nghành
on a large scale: trên một quy mô lớn
▪ Developing countries will need help on a large scale for many years to come.
Sự phát triển quốc gia sẽ cần hỗ trợ trên một quy mô lớn trong nhiều năm sắp tới

children.name: crucial
children.definition: /ˈkruːʃəl/  something that is crucial isextremelyimportant, because everything that happens afterwards depends on it:
examples: quyết định , chủ yếu , cốt yếu [tính từ ] 1 thứ gì đó là chủ yếu là cực kì quan trọng , bởi vì mọi thứ xảy ra sau đó phụ thuộc vào nó
▪ Crucial decisions had to be made, involving millions of dollars.
Những quyết định cốt yếu phải được thực hiện, nó liên quan đến hàng triệu đô la
▪ The crucial factor in their relationship was their unshakeable faith in each other.
Yếu tố quyết định trong mối quan hệ của họ là niềm tin bền vững của mỗi người
crucially[adverb]
trọng yếu [trạng từ ]
▪ The test results were crucially important.
Các kết quả xét nghiệm rất quan trọng

children.name: important
children.definition: sth that is important should be given special attention because it is very necessary: quan trọng , cần thiết
examples: ▪ Young children should be given a healthy diet - that’s very important.
importance[U] how important and necessary something is:
importance of
▪ Most people realize the importance of getting enough sleep.

children.name: it’s important to do sth
examples: ▪ It is important to read the instructions carefully before you start.

children.name: it is important that
examples: ▪ It is important that everyone understands the risks involved in this plan.

children.name: vital
children.definition: something that is vital is very important and necessary, and if it is not done or dealt with correctly there could be serious problems: quan trọng , sống còn
examples: ▪ nurses, police officers and other workers who provide vital services
vital to
▪ His evidence was vital to the defence case.
it is vital that
▪ It is vital that leaking gas pipes are fixed immediately.

children.name: essential
children.definition: /ɪˈsenʃəl/  extremely important to the existence, health, safety etc of someone or something: chủ yếu, cốt yếu
examples: ▪ Emergency services such as medical supplies must be maintained at all times
essential to
▪ The layer of fat on the baby seal’s body is essential to its survival
it is essential that
▪ It’s essential that you wear protective clothing in this area.

children.name: significant
children.definition: /of great significance/sɪgˈnɪfɪkənt, əv ˌgreɪt sɪgˈnɪfɪkəns/  important enough to be noticed and considered and to make a difference to a situation:
examples: quan trọng, đáng kể [tính từ ] đủ quan trọng để chú ý và xem xét và để tạo ra sự khác biệt cho tình huống
▪ There has been a significant change in people’s attitude to the environment.
Đã có 1 sự thay đổi đáng kể trong thái độ của mọi người đối với môi trường
▪ Winning the award was a significant achievement.
Chính thắng giải thưởng là 1 thành tựu đáng kể
▪ a significant new discovery, which will improve our understanding of the AIDS virus
1 phát hiện mới quan trọng, nó sẽ cải thiện sự hiểu biết của chúng ta về virut AIDS

children.name: big
children.definition: /bɪg/
examples: big decision/event/occasion/day etcan important decision, event etc, especially one that will influence or affect the rest of your life:
quan trọng [tính từ ] 1 quyết đinh/sự kiện/dịp/ngày vâng vâng quan trọng 1 quyết định, ngày vâng vâng quan trọng đặc biệt nó sẽ ảnh hưởng hay ảnh hưởng đến cuộc đời bạn
▪ This is a big decision - you’ll have to give me time to think.
Đây là 1 quyết định quan trọng - bạn nên cho tôi thời gian để suy nghĩ
▪ Graduation Day is one of those big occasions when everyone wants a souvenir photograph.
Ngày lễ tốt nghiệp là 1 trong những dịp quan trọng khi mọi người muốn có tấm hình kỉ niệm
the big dayespecially spoken a very important day in someone’s life
ngày cưới đặc biệt nói là 1 ngày rất quan trọng trong cuộc đời của 1 ai đó
▪ I hear you’re getting married - when’s the big day?
Tôi nghe bạn sẽ kết hôn - Ngày cưới là khi nào ?

children.name: momentous
children.definition: momentous event/decision/occasion etc something that is very important because it has a very great effect or influence on future events: quan trọng, trọng yếu
examples: ▪ At this point William made a momentous decision -- he resigned from his job and joined the army.
▪ The revolution taking place in eastern Europe must be counted as one of the most momentous events of this century.

children.name: major
children.definition: /ˈmeɪdʒəʳ/  one of the most important or serious things - use this especially when there is a small number of very important things, but a larger number of less important things:

children.name: ▪ Smoking is a major cause of heart disease
examples: ▪ All the world’s major sporting events can be seen on HHS TV.
▪ It’s the chief executive who makes all the major decisions.

children.name: key
children.definition: /kiː/ key role/factor/issue etcsomeone or something that has an extremely important effect on the way something develops:

children.name: critical
children.definition: a time or situation that is critical is extremely important and possibly dangerous because your future will depend on what happens or is decided at that time: nghiêm trọng , quan trọng
examples: ▪ These accusations came at a critical phase in the negotiations.

children.name: critical for
examples: ▪ The next few months could be critical for the whole mining industry.

children.name: essentials
children.definition: /ɪˈsenʃəlz/  things that are important because they are necessary for life or for doing something: yếu tố cần thiết , thiết yếu
examples: ▪ The refugees were provided with the essentials -- food and shelter, but nothing more.

children.name: bare essentialsthe most necessary things
examples: ▪ We don’t have much room for luggage so we’re only taking the bare essentials.

children.name: basics
children.definition: /ˈbeɪsɪks/  the most necessary things that you need to know, understand, have etc before you can understand or do something: căn bản
examples: ▪ You have to understand the basics before you can move on to more advanced work.

children.name: ways of stating the main reason for sth or the main part of sth
mainly
children.definition: /ˈmeɪnli/  use this to say what the main reason for something or the main part of something is:chính, chủ yếu
examples: ▪ I was asked to lead the meeting mainly because Kristin is out of town.
Tôi được yêu cầu chủ trì cuộc họp chính bởi vì Kristin đã ra khỏi thị trấn.
▪ My new job’s fairly boring - it’s mainly typing.

children.name: Công việc mới của tôi khá buồn chán, nó chủ yếu là đánh máy
examples: ▪ The company sells its batteries mainly through electronics stores.

children.name: Công ty bán pin chủ yếu qua cửa hàng điện tử
largely
children.definition: /chiefly/ˈlɑːʳdʒli, ˈtʃiːfli/  largely and chiefly mean the same as mainly, but they are used especially in written or formal English:chủ yếu, phần lớn
examples: ▪ The bird lives chiefly on mice and other small animals.
▪ The report says that drug use is largely responsible for the 40% rise in the city’s homicide rate.
▪ Money raised by the new tax is to be used chiefly for road construction.

children.name: primarily
children.definition: /principally firstly and most importantly:chủ yếu, chính
examples: ▪ Foreign aid is intended principally for the south of the region.
▪ The agency is primarily concerned with making sure the nation’s food supplies are safe.
▪ She has a degree in anthropology, but she’s primarily a writer.

children.name: above all
children.definition: /əˌbʌv ˈɔːl/  most importantly compared to other things, especially ones you have just mentioned:trên hết

children.name: ▪ Above all, she will be remembered for all the work she did in the community
examples: ▪ Teaching history means above all knowing how to tell a story.

children.name: first and foremost
children.definition: /ˌfɜːʳst ənd ˈfɔːʳməʊst/  use this to say that something is the most important thing, and needs to be dealt with before anything else and given attention before anything else:đầu tiên và trước hết
examples: ▪ First and foremost, they are looking for ways to save money.
▪ What children need first and foremost from their parents is a sense of security.

children.name: leading
children.definition: /ˈliːdɪŋ/  leading scientist/ politician/ company etc a scientist, politician etc who is well-known and successful, and who usually has a lot of influence:
examples: dẫn đầu , lãnh đạo [tính từ đứng trước danh từ ] nhà khoa học / chính trị gia / công ty hàng đầu vâng vâng 1 nhà khoa học , chính trị gia người nổi tiếng và thành công , và họ thường có nhiêuf ảnh hưởng
▪ She was one of America’s leading athletes.
Cô ấy là 1 trong những vận động viên hàng đầu
▪ Some of the world’s leading politicians will be meeting in Geneva to discuss disarmament.
1 trong những chính trị gia hàng đầu thế giới sẽ họp tại Geneva để thảo luận về giải trừ quân bị
leading lightone of the most important and active people in an organization
nhân vật quan trọng nhất 1 trong những người quan trọng và năng động nhất trong 1 tổ chức
▪ Debbie was one of the leading lights in the drama club.
Debbie là 1 trong những người quan trọn nhất trong câu lạc bộ kịch

children.name: influential
children.definition: /ˌɪnfluˈenʃəl◂/  important and having a lot of influence especially in politics or business:
examples: người có tầm ảnh hưởng [tính từ ] quan trọng và có nhiều ảnh hưởng đặc biệt là trong chính trị và kinh doanh
▪ Jacobson’s one of the most influential people in New York.
▪ The program has gained the support of several influential businessmen.
influential in doing something
▪ Various groups were influential in shaping public policy.
highly influential
▪ a highly influential member of Hong Kong’s banking community

children.name: prominent
children.definition: important, well-known, and respected in politics, business, education etc: nổi bật, xuất chúng , lỗi lạc
examples: ▪ Daguerre was a prominent Mexico City lawyer.
▪ The conference was attended by both government officials and prominent academics.
▪ Politicians who are prominent in public life may be at risk from terrorism.

children.name: valued
children.definition: valued friend/worker/customer etcsb who is considered important because they provide a lot of support, business, service etc - used especially in advertisements and business contexts: yêu quý, quý trọng
examples: I had a letter from William, one of my most valued friends.

children.name: The most valued workers in the factory are the technicians
examples: The company is offering discount to its valued customers.

children.name: foremost
children.definition: adjective

children.name: most important or best; leading
examples: _This is one of the country's foremost arts centres.
_She's one of the foremost experts on child psychology.

children.name: imperative
children.definition: adjectiveURGENT
examples: _[ + that ]The president said it was imperativethatthe release of all hostages be secured.
_[ + to infinitive ]It's imperativetoact now before the problem gets really serious.

children.name: extremely important or urgent; needing to be done or given attention immediately
meaningful
children.definition: adjectiveIMPORTANT/SERIOUS

children.name: useful, serious or important
examples: _She seems to find it difficult to form meaningful relationships.
_Having the opportunity to work would make retirement more meaningfulformany pensioners.

children.name: notable
children.definition: adjective
examples: important and deserving attention, because very good or interesting
_a notable collection of rare plants
_Getting both sides to agree was a notable achievement.
_This attractive building is particularly notableforits garden setting.

children.name: radical
children.definition: adjectiveVERY IMPORTANT

children.name: relating to the most important parts of something or someone; complete or extreme
examples: _We need to make some radicalchangesto our operating procedures.
_She has had to undergo radical surgery (= aimed at removing the cause of a disease) .

children.name: radicallyadverbC1
examples: _Barker introduced some radically new ideas.

children.name: sacred
children.definition: adjective

children.name: considered too important to be changed
examples: _His daily routine is absolutely sacredtohim.
_humorousThe cricketers wore blue, not their usual white - isnothingsacred?

children.name: serious
children.definition: adjectiveNEEDING ATTENTION

children.name: burning issue
children.definition: /question
examples: a subject or question that must be dealt with or answered quickly

children.name: value
children.definition: verbIMPORTANCE

children.name: to consider something important
examples: _I've always valued her advice.

children.name: ultimately
children.definition: adverb

children.name: used to emphasize the most important fact in a situation
examples: _Ultimately, he'll have to decide.

children.name: supreme
children.definition: adjective,adverb
examples: having the highest rank, level or importance
_the supreme commander of the armed forces
_the Supreme Court
_The present constitution gives supreme authority to the presidency.
_From 1960 to 1970, Ayatollah Mohsen al-Hakimreignedsupreme among the Shi'ites of Iraq, Iran and elsewhere.

children.name: substantially
children.definition: adverbLARGE

children.name: to a large degree
examples: _The new rules will substantially change how we do things.
